org.gbif.crawler

Interface ResponseHandler<RESPONSE,RESULT>

  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE - the type of response to handle. This is dependent on the CrawlClient implementation
    RESULT - the type of result this response handler produces when processing a response
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractResponseHandler, BiocaseResponseHandler, DigirResponseHandler, TapirResponseHandler

    public interface ResponseHandler<RESPONSE,RESULT>
    Implementations of this interface will handle the response received by CrawlClients and produce a result but it also plays a part in the paging through resources.

    They have three jobs:

    • Convert the response into a format that is suitable for shipping as a message
    • Extract information from the response that is important for paging
    • Extract enough information from the response to see if it is a duplicate response

    • Method Detail

      • handleResponse

        RESULT handleResponse(RESPONSE response)
                      throws FatalCrawlException,
                             ProtocolException,
                             TransportException
        Handles a response and produces a result.
        Parameters:
        response - to be handled
        Throws:
        ProtocolException - Implementation specific
        TransportException - Implementation specific
        FatalCrawlException

      • isValidState

        boolean isValidState()
        This can be used to see if this response handler is in an illegal state or not. This can happen after parsing a wrong response or if there has been a transport exception. A proper response needs to be handled for this to be cleared.
        Returns:
        false if the other getter methods will throw a IllegalStateException

      • getRecordCount

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Integer> getRecordCount()
        Returns:
        the number of records in this page

      • isEndOfRecords

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Boolean> isEndOfRecords()
        Returns:
        true if there are more records to extract

      • getContentHash

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Long> getContentHash()
        Returns:
        a hash value for the current page. This can be used to detect duplicate pages.
